intro: Hieracium subcaesium subsp. angulatum, commonly known as the angular hawkweed, is a flowering plant native to parts of Europe and western Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and ragworts. The plant is characterized by its upright growth habit and yellow flowers arranged in a flat-topped inflorescence. Its leaves are typically lobed and have a rough texture, and the stems are often hairy. It thrives in open, disturbed habitats such as meadows and roadsides.
